gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: mcb_soft_calibration

Explanation: This module performs soft calibration for a memory controller block (MCB). It handles initialization, termination calibration, and dynamic calibration of DQS (Data Strobe) signals. The module goes through various states to configure termination resistances, adjust DQS delays, and optimize signal integrity. It includes features for self-refresh handling, PLL locking, and interfaces with IODRP (I/O Digital Reconfiguration Port) controllers. The calibration process aims to improve memory interface performance by fine-tuning signal timing and impedance matching.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
Input ports:
UI_CLK, RST, PLL_LOCK, SELFREFRESH_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE, RZQ_IN, RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IN, ZIO_IODRP_SDO, MCB_UOSDO, MCB_UODONECAL, MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG, MCB_UODATA, MCB_UODATAVALID, MCB_UOCMDREADY, MCB_UO_CAL_START.

Explanation:
- UI_CLK: Input clock signal
- RST: Reset signal
- PLL_LOCK: PLL lock status
- SELFREFRESH_REQ: Self-refresh request
- SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE: Self-refresh MCB mode
- RZQ_IN, ZIO_IN: Reference impedance inputs
- RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IODRP_SDO: IODRP serial data outputs
- MCB_UOSDO: MCB serial data output
- MCB_UODONECAL: MCB calibration done signal
- MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG: MCB refresh flag
- MCB_UODATA: MCB data output
- MCB_UODATAVALID: MCB data valid signal
- MCB_UOCMDREADY: MCB command ready signal
- MCB_UO_CAL_START: MCB calibration start signal

Output ports:
DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL, SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MODE, IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI, RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS, MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIDRPUPDATE, MCB_UIBROADCAST, MCB_UIADDR, MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL, MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC, MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIREAD, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC, MCB_RECAL, MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT, MCB_SYSRST, Max_Value, CKE_Train.

Explanation:
- DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL: Calibration completion signal
- SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MODE: Self-refresh control signals
- IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI: IODRP control signals
- RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS: IODRP chip select signals
- MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIDRPUPDATE, MCB_UIBROADCAST, MCB_UIADDR, MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL: MCB control signals
- MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC, MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC: DQ and DQS adjustment signals
- MCB_UIREAD, MCB_RECAL, MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT: MCB operation control signals
- MCB_SYSRST: System reset signal
- Max_Value: Maximum calibration value
- CKE_Train: CKE training signal

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
Internal signals:
STATE, P_Term, N_Term, P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w, P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev, IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR, IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA, Active_IODRP, IODRPCTRLR_R_WB, IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_CMD_VALID, MCB_USE_BKST, Pre_SYSRST, IODRP_SDO, Max_Value_Previous, count, counter_en, First_Dyn_Cal_Done, DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY, counter_inc, counter_dec, RST_reg, Block_Reset, MCB_UODATAVALID_U, RstCounter, LastPass_DynCal, First_In_Term_Done.

Explanation:
- STATE: Represents the current state of the calibration process
- P_Term, N_Term: Termination values for P and N
- P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w: Skewed termination values
- P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev: Previous termination values
- IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR: Address for IODRP controller memory cell
- IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA: Data to be written to IODRP controller
- Active_IODRP: Indicates which IODRP is currently active
- IODRPCTRLR_R_WB: Read/Write control for IODRP controller
- IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, MCB_CMD_VALID: Command valid signals
- IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_USE_BKST: Broadcast control signals
- Pre_SYSRST: Internal system reset signal
- IODRP_SDO: IODRP serial data output
- Max_Value_Previous: Previous maximum calibration value
- count, counter_en: Counter for timing control
- First_Dyn_Cal_Done: Flag for first dynamic calibration completion
- DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY: DQS delay values
- counter_inc, counter_dec: Counters for increment and decrement operations
- RST_reg: Registered reset signal
- Block_Reset: Reset blocking signal
- MCB_UODATAVALID_U: Registered MCB data valid signal
- RstCounter: Counter for reset timing
- LastPass_DynCal: Indicates the last pass of dynamic calibration
- First_In_Term_Done: Flag for first in-termination completion

These internal signals are used to control the calibration process, store intermediate values, and manage the state machine for the soft calibration module.
